streak.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a coloured line, especially one that is not straight or has been made accidentally
streak.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Sue has blonde streaks in her hair.
streak.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a part of someoneâ€™s character that is different from the rest of their character
streak.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: His serious nature was lightened by a streak of mischief.
streak.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a period of time during which you continue to be successful or to fail
streak.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Celtic are on a six-game winning streak.
streak.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to run or fly somewhere so fast you can hardly be seen
streak.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Two jets streaked across the sky.
streak.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to cover something with lines of colour, liquid etc
streak.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The sky was streaked yellow and purple.
His hands and arms were streaked with paint.
streak.translation[1].definitions[1].not: Streak is usually passive in this meaning
streak.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to run across a public place with no clothes on as a joke or in order to shock people
